metadata.Title: CVE-2012-6615 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: The ff_ass_split_override_codes function in libavcodec/ass_split.c in FFmpeg before 1.0.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and crash) via a subtitle dialog without text.

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 19.10, the chromium-browser package is just a script that installs the Chromium snap

criterions.comment: gst-libav1.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mythtv: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
oxide-qt package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
vice: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
